email.heading: Women's Panel
email.text:
Thursday 18th February – 18:00 – 19:30 (GMT)
Meet inspirational women ready tell you about how they carved their unique career paths and who’ll be available to answer your questions. This event is hosted on MS Teams and will include brief introductions followed by a chat-show style discussion and questions submitted by the audience.
Our inspiring female speakers include panelists from:
* Institution of Civil Engineers
* Facebook
* Imperial College London
The event is organised by the Careers Service and will be co-hosted by Pria Pretheshan, ICU Gender Equality Officer.
Booking is required via JobsLive to receive the join link, book here - https://imperial.targetconnect.net/leap/event.html?id=15509&service=Careers+Service
email.heading: The Equality, Diversity and Culture Committee
email.text:
Do you want to help encourage diversity and equality in Computing and represent your view? The Equality, Diversity and Culture Committee (EDCC) strive to continually maintain and improve equality and diversity amongst staff and students. Their current objectives are:
No staff or student should be disadvantaged because of their gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability or any other protected characteristics (Equality Act 2010).
* The Department should provide an inclusive environment for all staff and students.
* The Department should strive for diversity of staff and students along all dimensions.
* The EDCC welcomes anyone to come and attend their bi-termly meeting to discuss such matters - all discussions are open!
If you feel you have experienced something you would like to discuss however do not feel comfortable attending the meeting please do one or all of the following:
* Talk to your year reps as they can discuss the issue for you.
* Submit anonymous feedback by form here: https://edcc.doc.ic.ac.uk/contact/
* Email anonymously to doc-equality@imperial.ac.uk - the exchange will be kept private
email.heading: To Research or Not To Research?

event.text:
This is the question!
Have you thought about doing a PhD and/or going into academia but you’re a bit uncertain what this is going to be like?
We’ll be hosting Q&A panel between academics and people that have a lot of experience in the industry (Robert Chatley, Paul Kelly and many others) answering your questions about a research career. Be that in academia or private companies, this type of career choice usually comes along with a lot of stereotypes and myths so we’re here to break it for you!
